p: Macrocarpals (30) and (31) with monoisotopic mass 454.2719 Da and molecular formula (C28H38O5) were identified as macrocarpal G and its isomer ( Yamakoshi et al., 1992) ( Table 1). Earlier, NMR analysis of macrocarpal G structure showed an absence of oxygen in the sesquiterpene part of the molecule and supposed that biosynthetically macrocarpal G is a product of dehydration of macrocarpal A or its isomers ( Yamakoshi et al., 1992).
